definition: to make money
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
money/wealth/riches/property/valuables
(idiom) amiability makes you rich
lit. there are principles behind making money (idiom); fig. to have a knack for good business/knowing how to accumulate wealth/good at feathering one's own nest

sentences.english: There is money to be made (indirectly for the creatives) by finding talent.
sentences.chinese: 發現天才就是生財之道。

sentences.english: And gas riches, honest service is our aim.
sentences.chinese: 和氣生財，誠信服務，是我們的宗旨。

sentences.english: This, in turn, can also give birth to many other wealth-generating projects.
sentences.chinese: 這最終也會帶來很多其它生財項目。

sentences.english: As the saying puts, harmony brings wealth.

definition: to seek luck and avoid calamity (idiom)
very rich/millionaire
small capital, huge profit (idiom); to put in a little and get a lot out
post horse
(of a political career) everything is going smoothly (idiom)
to be promoted and gain wealth (idiom)
lit. outside-flexible, inside-firm (idiom)/fig. velvet glove
to plan matters/to look for a job
abundant harvest of all food crops/bumper grain harvest
everything/every matter
riches and honor
profits pouring in from all sides (idiom)/raking in money/bonanza
to arrive home/facing one's home/home-coming/(soccer) facing the goalmouth
to be successful in every endeavor
lit. to have accumulated knowledge and deliver it slowly (idiom)/good preparation is the key to success/to be well prepared
to cower by military force/deterrence
